title: Distraught Houston Astros players look on in horror after staffer is hit by foul ball
text:
A foul ball that flew off the bat of Houston Astros' Michael Brantley into the team dugout during an American League Champion Series game struck a paramedic in the head.

The moment the ball struck the man, during game two of the series against the New York Yankees on Sunday, was not caught on camera.

All that is seen is the Astros outfielder hitting a foul at the ball thrown by Yankees pitcher Adam Ottavino during the game's fifth inning, at Minute Maid Park, in Houston, Texas.

Then, pitcher, catcher, and umpire all appear to turn their heads towards the Astros dugout as Mr Brantley walks off to the side of the pitch, head cast downwards.

After his foul ball struck the paramedic in the head Houston Astros left fielder Michael Brantley looks upset. His manager AJ Hinch comes onto the pitch to console him

Security guard in the Astros' dugout was hit by the ball pic.twitter.com/MnfAWdzqyn — #BusinessIsSuspended (@FTBeard11) October 14, 2019

The man, a medic, can be seen holding a bloody towel to his head as a man helps him out of the dugout

The camera then shifts its view into the dugout, where a number of distraught-looking Astros players, some with hands on their heads in dismay, look on as people tend to the injured man.

Pictures taken moments after the foul was struck also show Mr Brantley looking upset as the outfield spoke to manager AJ Hinch.

The New York Post reported the game was paused, as fans and players looked on in evident concern, until the injured man is seen walking with a towel on his head, out of the stadium, to a waiting ambulance.

Play resumes shortly after, with Mr Brantley striking out after making it to first base.

Houston Astros player Carlos Correa reacts after the man was hit by a foul ball in game two of the American League Championship Series between the Houston Astros and the New York Yankees at Minute Maid Park on October

Michael Brantley was emotional after his foul ball struck a security guard in the Astros' dugout tonight. Players on both sides were extremely concerned https://t.co/pFygzyx2xw #alcs #AstrosVSYankees #Astros #AstrosTwitter — Larry Brown (@LBSports) October 14, 2019

Harris County Emergency Corps released a media statement confirming one of its employees was hit in the head and taken to hospital, where he was now in a stable condition - but gave no other details.

Talking to media after the game, Mr Brantley, offered his thoughts and prayers to the family of the injured medic and expressed his wish that he could 'talk to him soon'.

Yahoo reported the paramedic was well-known to the Houston Astros team.

Earlier this year a two-year-old girl who was also struck by a foul ball at a Houston Astros-Chicago Cubs game.

She has suffered serious injuries including a skull fracture and a seizure and is now on medication.
description: A foul ball that flew off the bat of Houston Astros' Michael Brantley into the team dugout during an American League Champion Series game in Houston struck a paramedic in the head.
